content.description:
This is an exceptionally fun climb with fun moves throughout. Often times you'll ask yourself if you should stick to the face, or stay more right where the large cracks are. Up to you, but sometimes the face will lead you astray.

On the right side of the arete. The right most climb on the wall. Has bolts, so that should help you find it.
Standard rack to 2". There are bolts... but you don't need them. Up to you!

Face climbing on tiny holds and feet, with a scary-as-shit traverse at the end. Crux at the very beginning, and then it doesn't really let up the whole time. There are good rests though, throughout, so milk 'em. The traverse is ridiculously fun and scary. Well bolted... but traverses on smeary feet does not foster confidence in me. Shares anchors with the two climbs to the right.

Only sport route. Just right of Swiss Family Robinson. There are bolts that continue up, but they don't go anywhere...
12 bolts and anchors. Cleaning this route is a serious job...

This is one ridiculously freaky 5.8 trad route. Head up the dihedral and then move right and up. The crux comes half-way through. You sort of have bad gear placements and to get over the lip you have to do a layback on bad holds. It's scary. Luckily there's a good stance to rest and get your focus on just before. After that, you'll head up another dihedral, and then move right into a crack that goes all the way to the top of the arete to the anchors that are shared with the routes that are just left and right of this climb.

This is on the left side of the arete.
Standard rack to 1". Anchors at the top.

This thing is pretty fucking awesome. Traverse out right a bit and head up the crack system. You can layback / face climb this section. Head up into the seriously awesome right leaning hand-jam crack. Yeah baby! After this you've got some weirdo placements and odd climbing. Before you pull the lip, clip the one bolt. From here, there may be one tricky move left before the anchors.

Left most route.
1 bolt and standard rack to 3"
Probably the best place to go in Paint Mountain, as it has the most amount of climbs (granted that's only 4...but still). Excellent granite that gets sun in the afternoon.
